com.w2.api.engine.robots

Class RobotManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.w2.api.engine.robots.RobotManager

  • public abstract class RobotManager
extends java.lang.Object
    `RobotManager` objects are used to manage a discovered or connected Wonder Workshop `Robot` (represented by `Robot`), including scanning and discoering operations

    The delegate pattern in order to report robot connection states to its caller.

      Get the 'Robot' given its id.
      abstract boolean isScanning()
      Indicates whether `RobotManager` is currently scanning for `WWRobot`.
      abstract void startPeriodicScan(int scanPeriod, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Scans for `Robot` periodically based on the given scan period.

      If scanPeriod is > 0, this method scans until a robot is found.

      Scans for `WWRobot` immediately.
      Scan operation continues until `stopScan` is called.
      On a successful scan a RobotScannedEvent object is posted to the System Event Bus(EventBusFactory.getSystemBus())

    • Method Detail

      • isScanning

        public abstract boolean isScanning()
        Indicates whether `RobotManager` is currently scanning for `WWRobot`.

      • startPeriodicScan

        public abstract void startPeriodicScan(int scanPeriod,
                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Scans for `Robot` periodically based on the given scan period.

        If scanPeriod is > 0, this method scans until a robot is found. Then, it will pause scanning until the specified scanPeriod elapses before scanning again. This operation will continue until `stopScan` is called.

        When a robot is scanned, the a RobotScannedEvent is posted to the System Event Bus.
        To register to the System Event bus refer to EventBusFactory.getSystemBus()
        Parameters:
        scanPeriod - scan period
        timeUnit - The unit of time used
        See Also:
        startScan(), stopScan()

      • startScan

        public abstract void startScan()
        Scans for `WWRobot` immediately.
        Scan operation continues until `stopScan` is called.
        On a successful scan a RobotScannedEvent object is posted to the System Event Bus(EventBusFactory.getSystemBus())
        See Also:
        startPeriodicScan(int, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit), stopScan()

      • stopScan

        public abstract void stopScan()

      • getAllKnownRobots

        public abstract java.util.List<Robot> getAllKnownRobots()
        Returns:
        Returns the set of all robots that were found during the scan

      • getAllDiscoveredRobots

        public abstract java.util.List<Robot> getAllDiscoveredRobots()
        Returns:
        Returns the list of 'Robot' objects available to be connected

      • getAllConnectedRobots

        public abstract java.util.List<Robot> getAllConnectedRobots()
        Returns:
        Returns the list of 'Robot' objects that are currently connected

      • getAllLostRobots

        public abstract java.util.List<Robot> getAllLostRobots()
        Returns:
        Returns the list of 'Robot' objects that were seen before but are not currently available

      • getRobot

        public abstract Robot getRobot(int robotId)
        Get the 'Robot' given its id.
        Parameters:
        robotId - - The id of the robot
        Returns:
        Returns the 'Robot' object given the robot id
